result.execSummary:
The defendant Dustin M. Gottschalk #577131 was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia to Manufacture, Compound, Convert, Produce, or Store Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(3)(a).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia to Manufacture, Compound, Convert, Produce, or Store Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(3)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Clerk Shirley.
Case Called: 3:03
Includes: 14CF240 and 14CF387
State appears by ADA Lance Leonhard.  Def appears in custody with Atty Peter Rotter.
ADA Leonhard states that a Preliminary Hearing needs to be done in 14CF387-Court proceeds to Preliminary hearing and Court questions defendant as to his understanding of waiving his preliminary hearing and court finds it is understood by the defendant. Waiver of prelim is filed and the State files an Information, Defendant waives it's reading and wishes to proceed to sentencing. Court grants.
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW
State moves to delete the 2nd and Subsequent Offense in Count 2 and Count 3 in 14CF240.
Court grants.
PLEA: 14CF240>>Count 1>>Possession of Meth/Repeater>>Guilty
Count 2>>Possess Drug Paraphernalia/Repeater>>Guilty
Count 3>>Possess Drug Paraphernalia/Repeater>>Guilty
14CF387>>Count 1>>Fraud/Repeater>>No Contest
COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty. 
COURT ORDERS: I&S in 14CF240>>Count 1>>5 years Prison broken down as 3 years IC and 2 years ES.
I&S>>Count 2>>6 years Prison broken down as 3 years IC and 3 years ES
and Count 3>>6 years Prison broken down as 3 years IC and 3 years ES.
14CF387>>Count 1>>6 years prison broken down as 3 years IC and 3 years ES.
All CONCURRENT to each other.
Defendant Placed on Probation for 3 years with Conditions of: 1 year MCJ on Count 1 in 14CF240 which is stayed for rule violations, assessment/counseling/treatment deemed appropriate by agent, CC, absolute sobriety, FTE/School or 5 hrs CS per week, Restitution in 14CF387 to Conexus Credit Union=5125.56 and Covantage Credit Union=$259.98. If he is revoked the defendant is eligible for programming.
